p: Your letter just rec'd. Bully to hear from you so soon.
Hello - and I'll write later!
Our rain came exactly on time, after a long dry spell. It's still rainging this morning.
We stopped in Springfield and it required only 10 minutes to reduce car payments to $20 per .
The place is very lovely.
I've begun going over the MS Enot Peanut, and there are, thus far, surprisingly few corrections. Beautiful job too - as usual. I'll soon send sheets to be corrected.
Max and the b-a-a-ad gals are well and happy.
Dr Katt says he didn't want to be president anyway as he is quite busy with his present territory.
We surely did have a lovely time with you , and we wish we were nearer to you - as we may be. Who knows?
We did not put anything in the basement. That was the ice man's trick.

Rec'd a coupld of really fine testimonials from the Pennsylvania engagements. These class talks are worth while evidently, and They refresh me strangely It's The "Otherness" Nothing is good without that.
Soon I'll be going on with Jed. Looks like a long run ahead, and I can arrange for enough monkey excrement to keep everything serene for a fruitful spell.
Mama and I are always happy together, and we'll enjoy the feel of eternity in
the steady flow of days and nights.
Oddie, we're due in the desert mountians - maybe next year. It will rain on us there, and there will be some thunder. Or maybe just thunder.
It's good to feel that the kids are all set to go for awhile in St. Louis. It's a fine arrangemetn all around; and I'm sure they'll be happy together.
Listened to the Convetion awhile last evening. God! What powerful deliberaton! Vox populi, vox dei! Wow!
Still, I'm gald about Wallace, who has a good

spirit and does know the joker in our social comedy. (I'm assuming he was chosen, as it seemed he would be when I went to bed.) But if he was chosen, the choice was not as popular one; it was dictated.
It's a pity the country has to go through the expensive nonsense of an election, considering that the result is known already.
